class.name: PhysicsBody2D
class.brief_description: Base class for all objects affected by physics in 2D space.
class.description: PhysicsBody2D is an abstract base class for implementing a physics body. All *Body2D types inherit from it.

method.name: add_collision_exception_with
method.description: Adds a body to the list of bodies that this body can't collide with.

method.name: get_collision_exceptions
method.description: Returns an array of nodes that were added as collision exceptions for this body.

method.name: get_collision_layer_bit
method.description: Returns an individual bit on the collision mask.

method.name: get_collision_mask_bit
method.description: Returns an individual bit on the collision mask.

method.name: remove_collision_exception_with
method.description: Removes a body from the list of bodies that this body can't collide with.

method.name: set_collision_layer_bit
method.description: Sets individual bits on the layer mask. Use this if you only need to change one layer's value.

method.name: set_collision_mask_bit
method.description: Sets individual bits on the collision mask. Use this if you only need to change one layer's value.

members.member: The physics layers this area is in. Collidable objects can exist in any of 32 different layers. These layers work like a tagging system, and are not visual. A collidable can use these layers to select with which objects it can collide, using the collision_mask property. A contact is detected if object A is in any of the layers that object B scans, or object B is in any layer scanned by object A.
The physics layers this area scans for collisions.
Both [member collision_layer] and [member collision_mask]. Returns [member collision_layer] when accessed. Updates [member collision_layer] and [member collision_mask] when modified.
